This appendix provides internal CQC resources, external guidance, and recommended reading for deeper learning. Resources are organized by topic and level.

---

## CQC Internal Resources

### Quality Assurance

**Quantitative Analytics and Statistics Quality Assurance Framework** (2025)  
Internal framework for ensuring analytical quality. Aligns with the AQuA Book. Defines roles, responsibilities, and quality standards for quantitative work.  
*Contact*: Practice Leads or federico.andreis@cqc.org.uk

**Data and Insight Quantitative Guild Terms of Reference** (2025)  
Defines the Guild's role in providing specialist statistical support, maintaining standards, and building analytical capability.  
*Access*: Internal CQC document

**Data and Insight Competency Framework** (2025)  
Outlines analytical competencies across career levels. Maps skills to training needs.  
*Access*: Internal CQC document

### Method-Specific Guidance

**Methodology for constructing z-scores** (CQC Data Science and Statistics Team, 2020)  
Comprehensive internal guidance on standard and working z-scores. Covers data types, minimum requirements, formulas, and trouble-shooting.  
*Access*: Internal CQC document  
*Note*: This book provides a more accessible introduction; consult the full guidance for implementation details.

**SPC Implementation Guidance** (if available)  
Internal guidance on applying SPC methods at CQC.  
*Contact*: Guild for current resources

## Government and Regulatory Standards

### Analysis Quality

**The Aqua Book: Guidance on producing quality analysis for government** (HM Treasury, 2015)  
Government standard for analytical quality. Covers the analytical cycle, QA processes, and communication.  
*Link*: [https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-aqua-book-guidance-on-producing-quality-analysis-for-government](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-aqua-book-guidance-on-producing-quality-analysis-for-government)

**Code of Practice for Statistics** (UK Statistics Authority, latest edition)  
Standards for producing official statistics. Principles of trustworthiness, quality, and value apply to CQC's analytical work.  
*Link*: [https://code.statisticsauthority.gov.uk/](https://code.statisticsauthority.gov.uk/)

### Statistical Methods

**Government Statistical Service (GSS) Guidance**  
Range of guidance on statistical methods, quality assurance, and communication.  
*Link*: [https://gss.civilservice.gov.uk/guidance/](https://gss.civilservice.gov.uk/guidance/)

## Academic and Professional Literature

### Z-scoring and Provider Comparison

**Spiegelhalter, D. J. (2005)**. Funnel plots for comparing institutional performance. *Statistics in Medicine*, 24(8), 1185-1202.  
Seminal paper on funnel plots for provider comparison. Explains relationship to z-scoring and overdispersion adjustment.

**Spiegelhalter, D., et al. (2012)**. Statistical methods for healthcare regulation: rating, screening and surveillance. *Journal of the Royal Statistical Society: Series A*, 175(1), 1-47.  
Comprehensive review of statistical methods for healthcare regulation, including z-scoring, funnel plots, and risk adjustment.

### Statistical Process Control

**Thor, J., et al. (2007)**. Application of statistical process control in healthcare improvement: systematic review. *Quality and Safety in Health Care*, 16(5), 387-399.  
Systematic review of SPC in healthcare. Documents benefits, limitations, barriers, and facilitating factors.

**Mohammed, M. A., Worthington, P., & Woodall, W. H. (2008)**. Plotting basic control charts: tutorial notes for healthcare practitioners. *Quality and Safety in Health Care*, 17(2), 137-145.  
Practical tutorial on creating and interpreting control charts in healthcare.

**Benneyan, J. C., Lloyd, R. C., & Plsek, P. E. (2003)**. Statistical quality control methods in infection control and hospital epidemiology, Part I: Introduction and basic theory. *Infection Control & Hospital Epidemiology*, 24(1), 7-16.  
Introduction to SPC methods for healthcare applications, with focus on infection control.

### Missing Data

**Little, R. J. A., & Rubin, D. B. (2019)**. *Statistical Analysis with Missing Data* (3rd ed.). John Wiley & Sons.  
Authoritative textbook on missing data theory and methods. Covers MCAR/MAR/MNAR framework and advanced techniques.

**van Buuren, S. (2018)**. *Flexible Imputation of Missing Data* (2nd ed.). CRC Press.  
Practical guide to multiple imputation with R examples. Accessible introduction to modern missing data methods.

**Laaksonen, S. (2018)**. *Survey Methodology and Missing Data: Tools and Techniques for Practitioners*. Springer.  
Applied perspective on missing data in surveys and administrative data.

## Recommended Textbooks

### Introductory Statistics

**Kirkwood, B. R., & Sterne, J. A. C. (2003)**. *Essential Medical Statistics* (2nd ed.). Blackwell.  
Clear introduction to statistics for healthcare applications. Covers core methods with medical examples.

**Altman, D. G. (1991)**. *Practical Statistics for Medical Research*. Chapman & Hall.  
Classic text on statistical methods in medical research. Emphasizes practical application and interpretation.

### Statistical Process Control

**Wheeler, D. J., & Chambers, D. S. (1992)**. *Understanding Statistical Process Control* (2nd ed.). SPC Press.  
Comprehensive introduction to SPC philosophy and methods. Industry standard reference.

**Provost, L. P., & Murray, S. K. (2011)**. *The Health Care Data Guide: Learning from Data for Improvement*. Jossey-Bass.  
SPC methods specifically for healthcare quality improvement. Practical examples and case studies.

### Advanced Methods

**Gelman, A., & Hill, J. (2006)**. *Data Analysis Using Regression and Multilevel/Hierarchical Models*. Cambridge University Press.  
Advanced regression methods including hierarchical models relevant to provider comparison.

**Harrell, F. E. (2015)**. *Regression Modeling Strategies* (2nd ed.). Springer.  
Advanced regression methods with emphasis on model validation and avoiding common pitfalls.

## Online Resources and Training

### R Programming

**R for Data Science** by Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund  
Free online book covering data manipulation, visualization, and analysis in R.  
*Link*: [https://r4ds.had.co.nz/](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/)

**RStudio Education**  
Tutorials, cheatsheets, and learning resources for R and RStudio.  
*Link*: [https://education.rstudio.com/](https://education.rstudio.com/)

### Python Programming

**Python for Data Analysis** by Wes McKinney  
Guide to data analysis with pandas, NumPy, and matplotlib.

**Real Python**  
Tutorials and courses on Python for data analysis.  
*Link*: [https://realpython.com/](https://realpython.com/)

### Statistical Methods

**NHS-R Community**  
Community of R users in healthcare. Resources, webinars, and support.  
*Link*: [https://nhsrcommunity.com/](https://nhsrcommunity.com/)

**Cross Validated (Stack Exchange)**  
Q&A site for statistics. Search before asking; most questions already answered.  
*Link*: [https://stats.stackexchange.com/](https://stats.stackexchange.com/)

## Software and Tools

### Statistical Software

**R and RStudio**  
Free, open-source software for statistical analysis. CQC's primary analytical tool.  
*Download*: [https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)

**Python (Anaconda Distribution)**  
Python with data science packages pre-installed.  
*Download*: [https://www.anaconda.com/download](https://www.anaconda.com/download)

### R Packages Used in This Guidance

**Data manipulation**:
- `dplyr`: Data manipulation
- `tidyr`: Data reshaping
- `readr`: Reading data files

**Visualization**:
- `ggplot2`: Creating plots
- `naniar`: Visualizing missing data

**Statistical methods**:
- `qcc`: Quality control charts (SPC)
- Base R stats functions for t-tests and z-scores

**Missing data**:
- `mice`: Multiple imputation
- `naniar`: Missing data visualization

### Python Packages

**Data manipulation**:
- `pandas`: Data manipulation and analysis
- `numpy`: Numerical computing

**Visualization**:
- `matplotlib`: Basic plotting
- `seaborn`: Statistical visualization
- `missingno`: Missing data visualization

**Statistical methods**:
- `scipy.stats`: Statistical tests
- `statsmodels`: Statistical models

## Citation Information

To cite this guidance:

> CQC Data and Insight (2025). *CQC Statistical Guidance: A Practical Guide for Analysts*. Care Quality Commission.

For specific sections, include the section title and URL when published.

---

## Document History

**Version 1.0** (December 2025): Initial release covering:
- **Part I: Foundations** (9 sections): Getting Started, Data Types, Describing Data, Variation & Uncertainty, Distribution Shape, Unusual Observations, Missing Data Foundations, Statistical Inference, QA Principles
- **Part II: Core Methods** (6 sections): Z-scoring, SPC Basics, t-tests, Correlation, Outlier Methods, Missing Data Methods
- **Part III: Worked Examples** (10 complete examples with R and Python code)
- **Appendices**: Glossary, References

**Planned for Version 2.0**: ANOVA, Chi-squared tests, advanced SPC methods (Bayesian, CUSUM, EWMA), case studies, interactive components.

**Feedback**: Contact the Guild or Practice Leads with suggestions for improvements or additional resources.
